intro: Borreria rosmarinifolia, commonly known as rosemary bush or sweet shrub, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, needle-like leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, and thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Borreria rosmarinifolia is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
